page.title: 09The Arts
page.content: Music and drama are well represented in Wool by the D'Urberville Amateur Dramatic and Operatic Society. First formed over ten years ago,and with humble beginnings,the Society now produces shows of very high quality. Musicaly the shows range from "Oklahoma","Carousel","Maritza",and "Merrie England",to many by Gilbert and Sullivan.e.g."The Mikado" performed in May 1985. Drama is represented both by straight plays and comedies.Recently comedy has proved more popular with audiences Previous plays have included "Ghost Train","The Hollow","The Happiest Days of Your Life" and "No Room For Love". With a now experienced core of players,newcomers are welcomed and encouraged.The company is grateful for the continued support of the local community.
